page.title: 04ECOLOGY..ABANDONED QUARRY
page.content: In our area there are several small abondoned whinstone quarries . One of these is on the slopes of Mount Hill and lies about 700 metres West of Mount Farm. The pool which has formed in the quarry covers an area of about 600 square metres and it is surrounded by shrubs,trees,gorse and reeds. The site offers an excellent habitat for plants and animals including wild duck,moorhen,frogs,newts and insects. The waters in the pool seem quite clean though there are traces of oil pollution. This is unfortunate because parts of the site are marred by a dump for local farm rubbish. Boulders, scrap metal, plastic and old fencing have been allowed to despoil the site.Hopefully in the future the site will be cleaned up and preserved as a small but valuable local wildlife habitat.
